title: Tales and sketches.
author: Miller, Hugh
snippet: In even the loneliest windings of the Crook Burn we find something to remind us of the world.

author: Miller, Hugh
snippet: hollow, pursues its downward way along the bottom of a deep-wooded ravine ; and so winding and circuitous is the course which, in the lapse of ages, it has worn for itself through a subsoil of stiff diluvial clay, that, ere a late proprietor  lined its sides with garden-flowers and pathways covered with gravel, and then willed that it should be named the " Ladies' Walk," it was known to the townspeople  as the Crook Burn.
